intro: Sigmatostalix aurosanguinea, commonly known as the golden blood vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by red or orange berries. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
